title: Expelled Juba Dal leader dies in jail custody
body: Waliur Rahman Uzzal, 37, expelled convener of Keshabpur Municipality unit of Jatyatatabadi Juba Dal, youth front of Bangladesh Nationalist Party, died in Jashore Central Jail after he was held by a team of the joint force early Saturday, Anwar Hossain, officer in-charge, Keshabpur police station, confirmed to New Age. Anwar said that four people including the Juba Dal man were handed over to Keshabpur station police on Friday after detaining them at the dead of night with a pistol, a number of sharp weapons, several bottles of alcohol, Yaba pills and cannabis. ‘We then produced them to the court from where they were sent to Jashore Central Jail,’ he said, adding that the jail authority told them that Uzzal died at the hospital. He also said that they were produced before the court after giving first aid at Keshabpur Upazila Health Complex. The other arrested were Jahangir Hossain Palash, 40, convener, Keshabpur Municipality unit of Swechhasebok Dal, voluntary wing of Bangladesh Nationalist Party, his brother M Alam, 35 and Md Rassel, 30. Abid Ahmed, jailor, Jashore Central Jail, said that Uzzal was declared dead after he had been rushed to Jashore General Hospital at night. Afzal Hossain Babu, elder brother of the victim claimed that his brother was tortured after his arrest.
